item.title: Semaphore: A Full-Body Keyboard
item.description: Semaphore is a full-body keyboard that uses OpenCV and MediaPipe's Pose detection to detect body landmarks from video input, calculate relative differences, and translate them into keys and commands sent via keyboard.

item.title: Show HN: GPT-4-powered web searches for developers
item.description: The website 'phind.com' is currently inaccessible, as it is using a security service to protect itself from online attacks that may have been triggered by certain actions, such as submitting a certain word or phrase, a SQL command, or malformed data.

item.title: Replacing my best friends with an LLM trained on 500k group chat messages
item.description: An LLM was trained on Izzy Miller's uncensored college-era group chat messages, resulting in better conversations with his best friends.

item.title: NPR quits Twitter after being labeled as 'state-affiliated media'
item.description: NPR halted their Twitter activity after Twitter labeled them as "state-affiliated media," a label NPR believes is inaccurate and misleading.

item.title: Mass layoffs & absentee bosses create a morale crisis at Meta
item.description: Morale is down at Facebook's parent company, Meta, due to mass layoffs and absentee bosses causing concern among the workers.

item.title: Hetzner Introduces ARM64 Cloud Servers
item.description: German hosting and cloud provider Hetzner has launched four new Hetzner Cloud servers based on Arm64 technology, marking the company's first use of the processors.

item.title: New NASA Director Swears Oath on Carl Sagan's 'Pale Blue Dot' Instead of Bible
item.description: Makenzie Lystrup, the newly appointed director of NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center, has taken an unconventional oath using Carl Sagan's 1994 book "Pale Blue Dot" instead of the Bible.

item.title: Intel Foundry Services & Arm announce collaboration on SoC design
item.description: Intel Foundry Services (IFS) and Arm have agreed to a multigeneration collaboration to enable the development of low-power compute system-on-chips (SoCs) for mobile devices and other industries.

item.title: EVE Online player uses obscure rule to pull off biggest heist in game history
item.description: An EVE Online player has conducted the largest heist in game history by exploiting the "shares mechanic," resulting in a haul of over $22,300 in real money.

item.title: Virtual Threads Arrive in JDK 21, Ushering a New Era of Concurrency
